intro: Ichnanthus longiglumis, commonly known as the long-beaked ichnanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its unique elongated calyx, which gives it its common name, is a distinctive botanical feature. Ichnanthus longiglumis is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
